chapters.title: Introduction to Ekalavya
chapters.description: Ekalavya, a young tribal prince, sought to learn archery under Guru Dronacharya but was refused due to his lineage.

chapters.title: Self-Taught Mastery
chapters.description: Undeterred, Ekalavya created a clay idol of Dronacharya and practiced rigorously, becoming an exceptional archer.

chapters.title: The Guru's Request
chapters.description: Dronacharya, upon witnessing Ekalavya's skills, requested his thumb as Guru Dakshina to preserve Arjuna's supremacy.

chapters.title: The Sacrifice
chapters.description: Ekalavya willingly cut off his thumb, showcasing his devotion to his teacher and the importance of duty over personal gain.
